西柏坡 ; np ; Xībǎipō ; Xibaipo; A village about 90 km from Shijiazhuang, Hebei province. It was the location of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the headquarters of the People's Liberation Army during the decisive stages of the Chinese Civil War between May 26, 1948 and March 23, 1949, at which point they were moved to Beijing. Today, the area houses a memorial site.

川贝枇杷糖浆 ; n ; chuānbèi pípa tángjiāng ; A brownish-red thick liquid (syrup) used in traditional Chinese medicine to "remove heat from the lungs, resolve phlegm and relieve cough, when there are symptoms of chronic bronchitis, cough and yellow-phlegm or difficulty in expectoration, painful swelling of the throat, or a choking sensation".
川贝雪梨膏 ; n ; chuānbèi xuělí gāo ; A concentrated herbal decoction used in traditional Chinese medicine to "nourish the yin of lungs, relieve cough, promote the production of body fluids and to eliminate phlegm, when there are symptoms of the deficiency of lung-yin, cough, asthma, or dryness of the oropharynx ".

穿山甲 ; n ; chuānshānjiǎ ; pangolin

川乌头 ; n ; chuānwūtóu ; root of the aconite, wolfsbane, or monkshood. (A root used in traditional Chinese medicine as a heart stimulant.)
穿心莲片 ; n ; chuānxīnlián piàn ; Common Andrographis tablets. These are prepared from Herba Andrographis (穿心莲) and are used in traditional Chinese medicine "to remove toxic heat, to reduce heat in the blood and promote subsidence of swelling in the treatment of cold and fever, ulcers in the mouth and on the tongue, whooping cough, phthisical cough, diarrhea and dysentery, dysuria with difficult painful urination, carbuncle and boil, and the bite of venomous snakes".
穿心莲 ; n ; chuānxīnlián ; Andrographis (An herb used in traditional Chinese medicine to treat mouth ulcers, and to reduce "heat".)
川芎茶调散 ; n ; chuānxiōng chátiáo sǎn ; A herbal powder used in traditional Chinese medicine to "dispel wind, and to relieve pain or headache caused by wind that is occasionally accompanied by chills, fever or nasal obstruction".

刺五加浸膏 ; n ; cìwǔjiā jìngāo ; An alcoholic extract of Manyprickle Acanthopanax (Acanthopanacis Senticosi) that is used in traditional Chinese medicine "to reinforce qi, to invigorate the function of the spleen and the kidney, and to calm the nerves when there is hypofunction of the spleen and the kidney marked by general weakness, lassitude, anorexia, aching of the loins and knees, or insomnia and dream-disturbed sleep."
刺五加片 ; n ; cìwǔjiā piàn ; Manyprickle Acanthopanax tablets used in traditional Chinese medicine "to reinforce qi, to invigorate the function of the spleen and the kidney, and to calm the nerves in the treatment of hypofunction of the spleen and the kidney marked by general weakness, lassitude, anorexia, aching of the loins and knees, insomnia and dream-disturbed sleep". These tablets are made from Acanthopanacis Senticosi (刺五加).
刺五加 ; n ; cìwǔjiā ; Eleutherococcus senticosus (formerly called Siberian ginseng, or Acanthopanax senticosus)

龟甲胶 ; n ; guījiǎjiāo ; The glue of tortoise shell used in traditional Chinese medicine to "nourish yin and blood, and to arrest bleeding, that may be indicated by symptoms of consumptive fever and night sweating due to deficiency of yin; weakness and aching of the loins and knees; anemia; abnormal uterine bleeding, or excessive leukorrhea". The glue of tortoise shell is typically in the form of dark-brown rectangular or square flat pieces that are hard and fragile. It is also known as colla carapacis et plastri testudinis in Latin.

大黄清胃丸 ; n ; dàhuáng qīngwèi wán ; A blackish-brown pill used in traditional Chinese medicine to "remove toxic heat, relax the bowels when there is exuberant fire in the stomach marked by dryness of the mouth and tongue, headache, dizziness, and constipation". Honey is used as the binding agent.
大黄蟅虫丸 ; n ; dàhuáng zhèchóng wán ; A black pill used in traditional Chinese medicine to "promote blood circulation, eliminate blood stasis, stimulate menstrual flow and disintegrate masses, treat squamous and dry skin, treat dark rings around the eye sockets, reduce hectic fever, emaciation and amenorrhea". Honey is the binding agent for the ingredients of pill.

颠茄酊 ; n ; diānqié dīng ; A brownish-red or brownish-green tincture prepared from Herba Belladonnae. It is used in traditional Chinese medicine and acts as an antispasmodic agent for smooth muscle, in the treatment of peptic ulcer and duodenal ulcer, colicky pain in the gastric-intestinal tract, kidney and biliary tract.
颠茄片 ; n ; diānqié piàn ; Belladonna tablets. These tablets contain the extract of Belladonnae, and are used in traditional Chinese medicine to reduce the secretions of glands, and also as an antispasmodic agent for smooth muscle, in the treatment of peptic ulcer and duodenal ulcer, and colicky pain in gastric-intestinal tract, kidney and biliary tract.

跌打活血散 ; n ; diēdǎ huóxuè sǎn ; A reddish-brown powder used in traditional Chinese medicine that may be prescribed internally with water or wine, or applied externally with wine or vinegar to "soothe the tendons, promote blood circulation, remove stasis and relieve pain for traumatic injuries, blood stasis or sprains."
跌打丸 ; n ; diēdǎ wán ; A blackish-brown pill used in traditional Chinese medicine to "promote blood circulation, remove stasis, induce the subsidence of swelling and relieve pain where indicated by traumatic injuries with bone fracture, ecchymosis, swelling and pain or sprain of back muscles". Honey is used as the binding agent.

定坤丹 ; n ; dìngkūn dān ; A blackish-brown pill used in traditional Chinese medicine to "nourish qi and blood, regulate menstruation, soothe the depressed liver, as well as to treat dysmenorrhea, abnormal uterine bleeding, morbid leucorrhea, anemia, exhaustion of blood, and various postpartum deficiency syndromes and hectic fever in consumptive diseases". Honey is used as the binding agent.

断血流片 ; n ; duànxuèliú piàn ; A sugar-coated tablet prepared from Herba Clinopodii Chinensis (断血流). It is used in traditional Chinese medicine "to arrest bleeding by reducing heat in the blood in the treatment of functional uterine bleeding, excessive menstrual discharge, postpartum hemorrhage, bleeding from hysteromyoma, hematuria, hematochezia, hematemesis, hemoptysis, epistaxis, simple purpura, and primary cytopenic purpura".

二十五味珊瑚丸 ; n ; èrshíwǔwèi shānhú wán ; A reddish-brown pill used in traditional Tibetan medicine to "promote the restoration of consciousness, promote blood circulation and relieve pain, when there are symptoms that include unconsciousness, numbness of body, dizziness, headache, abnormal blood pressure, epilepsy and cranial neuralgia".

当归流浸膏 ; n ; dāngguī liújìngāo ; A dark brown ethanolic extract of Chinese Angelica (当归)used in traditional Chinese medicine "in the treatment of peptic ulcer and duodenal ulcer, colicky pain in gastric-intestinal tract, kidney and biliary tract". It is anticholinergic and acts as antispasmodic agent for smooth muscle, and reduces secretions of glands. It is contraindicated in patients with glaucoma.

复方鸡血滕膏 ; n ; fùfāng jīxuèténg gāo ; A black dry extract of Kadsura and other herbs that, when stewed in water and wine, is used in traditional Chinese medicine "to nourish blood and activate blood circulation, to normalize menstruation, marked by deficiency of the blood, numb hands and feet, painful aching of the joints, and irregular menstruation”.

复方皂矾丸 ; n ; fùfāng zàofán wán ; A sweet brownish-black or bluish-black pill used in traditional Chinese medicine "to warm the kidney and invigorate the marrow, to tonify qi and nourish yin, and to promote the growth of blood and arrest bleeding, when indicated by aplastic anemia, thrombocytopenia, myelodysplastic syndrome, injuries of the marrow, leukopenia due to radiotherapy or chemotherapy, deficiency of kidney-yin or insufficiency of qi and blood".

龟龄集 ; n ; guīlíngjí ; A capsule used in traditional Chinese medicine "to promote health, to tonify the brain, to consolidate the kidney, to replenish qi , and to promote appetite, in the treatment of the deficiency of kidney yang marked by impairment of memory, nocturnal emission and weakness of the loins and legs or diarrhea before dawn, cough due to deficiency of qi, or anorexia.".

桂附地黄丸 ; n ; guìfù dìhuáng wán ; A blackish-brown pill used in traditional Chinese medicine "to reinforce yang of the kidney, in the treatment of deficiency of yang of the kidney marked by a cold sensation in the loins and knees, edema of the limbs, oliguria, polyuria, retention of fluid with cough, dyspnea or diabetes". The binding agent is honey.
桂附理中丸 ; n ; guìfù lǐzhōng wán ; A brown pill used in traditional Chinese medicine "to tonify the yang of the kidney, and to warm and invigorate the spleen and stomach, in the treatment of consumption of the kidney yang and deficiency cold of the spleen and stomach marked by epigastric and abdominal pain with a cold sensation, vomiting, diarrhea and cold limbs". The binding agent is honey.

活血化瘀药 ; n ; huóxuè huàyū yào ; blood-circulation activating and blood-stasis removing materia medica in traditional Chinese medicine. This term refers to herbs and other medicinal substances that are used to activate the blood and to remove blood-stasis in the body. Some of these herbs are meant for external use, some for internal use, and some for both external and internal applications.
活血止痛散 ; n ; huóxuè zhǐtòng sǎn ; A greyish-brown powder used in traditional Chinese medicine "to activate blood circulation, eliminate stasis, promote the subsidence of swelling and alleviate pain in the treatment of traumatic injuries with ecchymosis, swelling and pain".

金水宝胶囊 ; n ; jīnshuǐbǎo jiāonáng ; A brown capsule used in traditional Chinese medicine "to nourish the lung and kidney, to arrest essence and tonify qi in the treatment of deficiency of lung and kidney, insufficiency of healthy qi, protracted cough and asthma of insufficiency type, mental weariness and lassitude, insomnia, amnesia, aching and limpness in the loins and knees, irregular menstruation, impotence and premature ejaculation, chronic bronchitis, chronic renal insufficiency syndrome, hyperlipemia, and hepatocirrhosis". The binding agent is honey.

六一散 ; n ; liùyī sǎn ; A pale yellowish-white powder used in traditional Chinese medicine "to remove summer-damp in the treatment of lassitude, thirst, diarrhea and oliguria with dark urine after exposure to summer-heat". It is also used as heat-rash powder externally.
六应丸 ; n ; liù yīng wán ; A brownish-black pill used, both externally and internally, in traditional Chinese medicine "to counteract toxicity, to cause subsidence of swelling and alleviate pain in the treatment of fire-toxin exuberating internally, tonsillitis, laryngitis, carbuncle, boils, ulcers, pharyngitis and insect-bites".

Honey is the binding agent.

七十味珍珠丸 ; n ; qīshíwèi zhēnzhū wán ; A pill used in traditional Tibetan medicine "to induce sedation, to promote blood circulation, regulating the function between qi and blood, to promote the restoration of consciousness in the treatment of "HeiBai Mai" and "Longxue Butiao" diseases, apoplexy, paralysis, hemiplegia, epilepsy, cerebral concussion, cardiac diseases, hypertension and mental disorders".

七味榼滕子丸 ; n ; qīwèi kèténgzǐ wán ; A blackish-brown pill used in traditional Chinese medicine "to expel summer heat, regulate the function of the spleen and stomach, and relieve spasm and pain in the treatment of vomiting, diarrhea, feelings of stuffiness in the chest, costal pain, headache and fever".
七味广枣丸 ; n ; qīwèi guǎngzǎo wán ; A red pill used in traditional Mongolian medicine "to nourish blood, replenish qi, and induce tranquilization in the treatment of distress and pain in the chest, cardiac palpitation, shortness of breath, restlessness, insomnia and forgetfulness".
七味葡萄散 ; n ; qīwèi pútáo sǎn ; A yellowish-brown powder used in traditional Mongolian medicine "to remove heat from the lungs, to relieve cough and dyspnea in the treatment of cough due to tuberculosis, dyspnea in the aged, a depressed sensation and stuffiness in the chest".
七味铁屑丸 ; n ; qīwèi tiěxiè wán ; A black pill used in traditional Tibetan medicine "to promote the flow of qi and blood, to subdue the hyperactivity of the liver, and to relieve pain in the treatment of pain in the hepatic region, and enlargement of the liver".

It is also used for long-term protection of the vocal cords.

人参健脾丸 ; n ; rénshēn jiànpí wán ; A brown honeyed pill used in traditional Chinese medicine "to invigorate the spleen and regulate the stomach function, to replenish qi and promote digestion in the treatment of anorexia, indigestion, epigastric distension, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, loose bowels or chronic diarrhea with malnutrition caused by weakness of the spleen and stomach".

Caution is typically advised as the pills are toxic if taken in large quantities.

僿莶丸 ; n ; xīxiān wán ; Siegesbeckia pills. Honeyed pills prepared from Herba Siegesbeckiae (僿莶草, 稀薟草, 希莶草, or 豨莶草), used in traditional Chinese medicine "to relieve rheumatism, to improve the motility of joints, and to counteract toxicity in the treatment of rheumatic arthralgia with aching and weakness of loins and knees, numbness of the limbs, hemiplegia, rubella, or sores with exudation".
豨莶丸 ; n ; xīxiān wán ; Siegesbeckia pills. Honeyed pills prepared from Herba Siegesbeckiae (僿莶草, 稀薟草, 希莶草, or 豨莶草), used in traditional Chinese medicine "to relieve rheumatism, to improve the motility of joints, and to counteract toxicity in the treatment of rheumatic arthralgia with aching and weakness of loins and knees, numbness of the limbs, hemiplegia, rubella, or sores with exudation".

消栓通络片 ; n ; xiāoshuān tōngluò piàn ; A sugar or film coated tablet used in traditional Chinese medicine "to promote blood circulation, to eliminate blood stasis, and to remove obstruction from the meridians and collaterals, in the treatment of hyperlipemia, hyponea, stiffness of the tongue, sluggish speech, asophia and cold limbs with pain on motion caused by cerebral thrombosis".

小儿百寿丸 ; n ; xiǎoér bǎishòu wán ; A brownish-red pill used in traditional Chinese medicine "to dispel wind-heat, to promote digestion, to arrest convulsion, and to resolve phlegm and relieve cough, in the treatment of upper respiratory infection in children with fever, headache, indigestion, retention of undigested food or milk, anorexia, cough and expectoration, or convulsion due to internal heat" .
小儿腹泻外敷散 ; n ; xiǎoér fùxiè wàifū sǎn ; A brownish-yellow powder used in traditional Chinese medicine "to warm the stomach and intestine, to dispel cold and damp, to invigorate the spleen, relieve pain and diarrhea, in the treatment of abdominal pain and diarrhea caused by indigestion, or asthenia-cold of stomach and intestine". It is typically mixed with vinegar and applied on the umbilical region or the "yong-quan" acupoint on the feet of children.
小儿肝炎颗粒 ; n ; xiǎo ér gānyán kēlì ; Yellowish-green granules used in traditional Chinese medicine "to remove the heat of liver and to relieve pain, in the treatment of hepatitis of children, pain at right hypochondriac region, abdominal flatulence, fever, nausea, vomiting, anorexia, fatigue, and jaundice".
小儿感冒茶 ; n ; xiǎoér gǎnmào chá ; pale brownish lumps of tea used in traditional Chinese medicine "to expel wind and induce diaphoresis, to remove toxic heat, in the treatment of cold due to wind-heat in infants, fever, distension and pain of the head, cough and sticky sputum, painful swelling of the throat, and influenza"
小儿化毒散 ; n ; xiǎo ér huàdú sǎn ; An orange-yellow to brownish-yellow powder used in traditional Chinese medicine "to remove heat, counteract toxicity, activate blood circulation and promote the subsidence of swelling, in the treatment of remnant toxic fever in children (after eruption of measles), accompanied by irritability, thirst, ulcers in the mouth, constipation, and festering boils".
小儿化食丸 ; n ; xiǎo ér huàshí wán ; A dark brown pill used in traditional Chinese medicine "to promote digestion, to relax the bowels, and to dispel fire in the treatment of children suffering from stomach heat and indigestion, abdominal flatulence, nausea and vomiting, irritability, thirst, and constipation".
小儿解表颗粒 ; n ; xiǎo ér jiěbiǎo kēlì ; Yellowish-brown granules used in traditional Chinese medicine "to release stagnated lung-qi and expel superficial evils, to remove heat and counteract toxicity, in the treatment of cold due to wind-heat, aversion to cold and fever, headache, cough, stuffy nose and watery nasal discharge, and painful itching of the throat".
小儿金丹片 ; n ; xiǎo ér jīndān piàn ; A dark-red tablet used in traditional Chinese medicine "to dispel wind and eliminate phlegm, to remove heat and counteract toxicity, in the treatment of cold due to wind-heat, internal exuberance of phlegm-fire, fever caused by influenza, headache, cough, asthma, swelling and pain of oropharynx, vomiting, high fever, and convulsion".
小儿惊风散 ; n ; xiǎo ér jīngfēng sǎn ; An orange-yellow or brownish-yellow powder used in traditional Chinese medicine "to relieve convulsion in the treatment of infantile convulsion accompanied by impairment of consciousness".
小儿清热片 ; n ; xiǎo ér qīngrè piàn ; A sugar-coated tablet used in traditional Chinese medicine "to remove heat and counteract toxicity, to dispel wind and relieve convulsion, in the treatment of children affected by wind-heat, irritability, convulsion, scanty dark urine, and constipation".
小儿清热止咳口服液 ; n ; ;xiǎo ér qīngrè zhǐké kǒufúyè ; A brownish-yellow liquid used in traditional Chinese medicine "to remove heat, to release stagnated lung-qi, to relieve asthma and soothe sore throat, in the treatment of affection by exopathogen of infants, virulent-heat exuberating internal, fever and cold, cough and yellow-phlegm, polypnea and wheeziness, dryness of mouth, hoarse and painful swelling of the throat".
小儿热速清口服液 ; n ; xiǎo ér rèsùqīng kǒufúyè ; An aromatic reddish-brown clear liquid used in traditional Chinese medicine "to remove heat and counteract toxicity, and reduce pharyngeal swelling, in the treatment of high fever caused by influenza, headache, sore throat, laryngitis, running and obstruction of nose, cough, and constipation".
小儿至宝丸 ; n ; xiǎo ér zhìbǎo wán ; An orange-yellow to brownish-yellow pill used in traditional Chinese medicine "to dispel wind, arrest convulsion, resolve phlegm and remove the retention of undigested food in the treatment of colds with indigestion in children, marked by fever, nasal obstruction, cough with much phlegm, vomiting, diarrhea, and even convulsion".

小金丸 ; n ; xiǎojīn wán ; A blackish-brown pill used in traditional Chinese medicine "to dissolve lumps and cause subsidence of swelling, to remove blood stasis and relieve pain, in the treatment of genital phlegmon at the early stage with swelling and pain but no discoloration of the skin; multiple abscesses; goitre, scrofula, breast carcinoma, and nodules of breast".
歇后语 ; n ; xiēhòuyǔ ; An idiomatic two part double pun. Part one is akin to a riddle, while part two is usually a double pun based on part one. The second part is often omitted. An example in English might be, "Make like a tree, and leave."

新清宁片 ; n ; xīnqīngnìng piàn ; A brown pill prepared from Radix et Rhizoma Rhei (大黄). It is used in traditional Chinese medicine "to remove heat and counteract toxicity, activate blood circulation and remove blood stasis, in the treatment of accumulation of heat in the body, swelling of throat, toothache, acute conjunctivitis, constipation, dysentery, infectious inflammation, and fever".

药材 ; n ; yàocái ; Medicinal materials or materia medica in traditional Chinese medicine. This includes herbs, minerals and other materials that are not plant-based. Most medicinal materials are dried herbs. Some medicinal materials have been "prepared" in a number of ways, including being fried in honey, salt, alcohol or vinegar. Other common methods of "preparation" include calcination, carbonization, and fermentation.

益母草口服液 ; n ; yìmǔcǎo kǒufúyè ; A clear, reddish-brown liquid used in traditional Chinese medicine "to promote blood circulation and remove blood stasis, to relieve swelling and dispel mass, to cool blood and staunch bleeding in the treatment of bleeding due to blood-heat, ecchymosis, and thrombocytopenic purpura". It is a herb mixture prepared from Motherwort or Herba Leonuri (益母草).

益心酮片 ; n ; yìxīntóng piàn ; A brown tablet prepared from Folium Crataegi. It is used in traditional Chinese medicine to activate blood circulation and remove blood stasis, to dredge the vessels in the heart, and to regulate the flow of qi and dredge the meridian passages, in the treatment of the stagnation of qi, blood stasis, a choking sensation in the chest, palpitation, amnesia, dizziness, tinnitus, coronary heart disease, angina pectoris, hyperlipemia, and ischemia of cerebral arteries.

呗 ; particle ; bei ; (colloquial) indicates obviousness or grudging agreement
的话 ; particle ; dehuà ; optional particle put at the end of a conditional clause
之 ; particle ; zhī ; Indicates that the previous word has possession of the next one. In English it functions like 's or like the word "of" but with the position of possessor and possessee switched. 的 (de) is more common but 之 is used in many set expressions.
之 ; particle ; zhī ; it (classical), same as 它 (tā).
〜 ; particle ; none ; Indicates the starting point of a range; from.
の ; particle ; de ; (Taiwan, Hong Kong, nonstandard) Possessive marker 的 (de).
の ; particle ; zhī ; (Taiwan, Hong Kong, nonstandard) Possessive marker 之 (zhī).

御宇 ; references ; yùyǔ ; ^ A reference to the Emperor Xuanzong of Tang, whose relationship to Yang Guifei brought to mind the Emperor Wu of Han's relationship to his concubine, Consort Li. Bai Juyi would have considered it unpoetic to refer to his subject directly.
